name: Knight Move 3D
description: A 3D recreation of Alexey Pajitnov's 1990 puzzle game 'Knight Move'. Programmed by a team of three using C++ in an OpenGL-based engine.

name: VRn't
description: A satirical arcade game playable in browser. Made in Unity over 72 hours in a team of four for the Ludum Dare 41 game jam, where it ranked among the top 20 games in 'Humor.'

name: Space Station Scoober
description: An experimental action arcade game playable in browser. Built in the game engine Pico-8.

name: Antiqua
description: An illustrated self-published collection of my poetry. Available for purchase online in a digital format.

name: Sugarplum Summit
description: A 'shoot 'em up' game playable in browser. This game was made in Unity originally over 72 hours in a team of three for the Ludum Dare 40 game jam. I designed, drew, and animated all sprites in addition to co-designing the game.

name: Shapeshift Crypt
description: A 'Binding of Isaac' styled game created over a semester in a group of four students with the Monogame game engine. I was responsible for all visual aspects of the game (UI, sprite work, art direction, animation, graphics programming) and assisted in gameplay design.

name: Stellar Standoff
description: A party game for mobile devices. Developed by a team of six in Unity with C# for a class project.
